qas.question: Where are the statues at in the Old Town?
Who created all the statues except the Zahringer fountain?

context: There are eleven Renaissance allegorical statues on <a0_0>public fountains<a0_0/> in the Old Town. Nearly all the 16th century fountains, except the Zähringer fountain which was created by <a2_0>Hans Hiltbrand<a2_0/>, are the work of the Fribourg master Hans Gieng. One of the more interesting fountains is the Kindlifresserbrunnen (Bernese German: Child Eater Fountain but often translated Ogre Fountain) which is claimed to represent a Jew, the Greek god Chronos or a Fastnacht figure that scares <a1_0>disobedient children.
